data.title: About Nursing Times
data.meta_description: About Nursing Times at Nursing Times. A leading source of nursing news and has been supporting nurses for over 100 years to improve their practice.
data.text:
Since its launch in 1905, Nursing Times has been the independent voice of nursing. We publish content that educates, informs and supports nurses at every stage of their career.

We produce articles, videos and much more that are designed to appeal to all parts of the profession, including student nurses and midwives, nursing associates and registered nurses.

Our content helps nurses improve their practice, keep them up to date with developments in nursing and healthcare policy and practice, and supports them in them in their career development.

The Nursing Times website has grown into the largest website for nurses outside of the US, with over 10 million annual page views and over 5 million unique visitors (Jan â€“ Dec 2023).

Latest nursing news and opinion

The news section provides comprehensive coverage of the latest developments in nursing, focused on the UK health and social care system, as well as some global news.

The section is updated daily with a range of news and features, including analysis, interviews and investigations.

You can also find news stories on certain subjects and settings by visiting the category pages listed in the news section or by using the drop down menu at the top of this page.

Meanwhile, the opinion section features views, comments and reflections written by nurses and nursing stakeholders. This includes articles by our regular columnists and contributors and the editor.

Visit News section or Opinion section

Clinical content, zones and series

The clinical section is a rich resource that comprises more than 6,000 double-blind peer reviewed articles on all aspects of nursing helping nurses keep up date and safe to care.

There, you can find the latest clinical content that we have published or search the subject list to find articles on best practice, latest evidence, and innovation in a particular subject area.

Each page in the section has up to date clinical articles, news, and opinion across almost 70 subjects, from conditions to care settings.

We also publish clinical series, comprehensive collections of clinical articles related to a particular subject or theme, for example, a condition, procedure or part of the body.

Visit the Clinical section

CPD Zone

The Nursing Times CPD Zone is our valuable online learning resource. The zone contains a range of more than 20 user-friendly online learning units on the fundamental aspects of nursing care. Each learning unit offers:

Guidance on how to register and complete the Nursing and Midwifery Council online revalidation process

Clinical articles with Nursing Times Journal Club discussion handouts for participatory CPD

Personal e-portfolio to store CPD and revalidation accounts, practice related feedback and log practice hours

Visit the CPD Zone

Ask Nursing Times

Ask Nursing Times is a powerful new tool launched to help nursing staff find the information and answers they need in seconds.

All you need to do is simply type in a question about nursing, be it on a clinical procedure or condition, a piece of government policy or pay levels, or how to get on in your career.

Powered by artificial intelligence, the new tool then gives a short summary in response to your question and cites the Nursing Times articles that it is sourced from for further reading.

Visit Ask Nursing Times

Student nurses

In addition, we have a student section dedicated to helping, guiding, and informing the future of the profession during their education journey.

This includes selected clinical articles, latest news on education and regular blogs from our current group of Nursing Times student editors.
